Night Shift Supervisor Manual

Overview

Supervisors are the leaders of the night shift warehouse teams, responsible for maintaining productivity, accuracy, and compliance across all operations. They oversee pickers, checkers, hi-lo operators, and clerks to ensure the shift runs efficiently and safely.

Supervisors typically work the full night shift, starting at 4:00 PM or 5:00 PM and ending when all work is complete (around 4:00 AM).

Shift Schedule and Breaks

Two 15-minute breaks

One 30-minute lunch break

Supervisors must monitor break times to ensure their team is taking breaks at the correct times and that work coverage is maintained.

Footwear: Steel-toe, above-ankle shoes are required for safety compliance.

Roles and Responsibilities

Supervisors are responsible for managing and guiding their teams. Each supervisor oversees a specific area:

Temperature Zone Supervisors: Each zone (dry, cooler, freezer) has a dedicated supervisor.

Picker/Checker Supervisor: Oversees picking and checking operations across the shift.

Core responsibilities include:

Monitoring team productivity and providing direction if performance falls behind.

Catching mistakes from team members and addressing them according to company policy.

Administering write-ups, suspensions, or recommending termination in consultation with Kudjoe.

Checking crew attendance and reporting missing or late employees to Kudjoe, noting whether they notified the supervisor or not.

Inspecting break rooms, locker rooms, and machine rooms to ensure employees are not taking unauthorized breaks.

Helping team members maintain speed and efficiency by jumping in to assist with tasks such as hi-lo operation or replenishment when needed.

Team Management and Communication

Supervisors must communicate clearly with their teams about expectations, productivity standards, and safety.

Providing feedback and guidance ensures employees understand how they are performing and what is required to meet shift goals.

Maintaining a visible presence on the floor keeps employees accountable and helps prevent errors or slowdowns.

Safety and Compliance

Supervisors enforce all safety protocols, including proper equipment use, warehouse traffic awareness, and personal protective equipment compliance.

Steel-toe shoes above the ankle are mandatory for all supervisors and strongly encouraged for employees.

Supervisors set the tone for safety culture on the floor and model proper procedures for employees.

Importance of the Role

Supervisors are essential to the success of the night shift. They ensure:

Employees are productive and accurate

Mistakes are caught and corrected immediately

Attendance and break policies are enforced

Workflow is smooth and the team meets nightly goals

By keeping the team organized, efficient, and accountable, supervisors directly contribute to the companyâ€™s operational success and customer satisfaction.

Best Practices

Walk the floor constantly to observe employee activity.

Address productivity issues promptly and constructively.

Assist team members when needed to maintain shift speed.

Monitor attendance and break compliance carefully.

Communicate with Kudjoe regarding staffing, performance issues, and any incidents.
